channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #193 - YAPC::NA Master classes updated
item.description:
Hi there!

The YAPC::NA web site now lists six Master classes. Check them out and register!

Enjoy!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Perl Developer - Teleperformance - Grandview Heights, Ohio (Columbus)
item.description: Teleperformance is looking for talented Perl developers who are eager to join our team (10 developers).Â We are a close-knit development group who live and breathe Perl and the open source philosophy.Â We are located in Grandview Heights, Ohio, with easy access to the downtown area.

item.title: InsideSales.com - Pass our "Perl Challenge" & Win a $100 Amazon Gift Card
item.description: Our yummy Perl codebase handles millions of emails in production each week! We're growing like crazy, doubling in revenue and size annually. We want you to join our team in Utah. Pass our "Perl Challenge" to win a $100 Amazon gift card and an interview. Hires will receive a sizable signing bonus.

item.title: Work for Uniregistry, building and maintaining Internet new Top Level Domains
item.description: Use Moose, DBIx::Class, Catalyst, AnyEvent and work in an dream office in Newport Beach office in California to Â build and maintain our registry platform and services for Internet new Top Level Domains (nTLDs). Send your CV to jobs@uniregistry.link

item.title: Saving Vertical Space
item.description: An example of refactoring a long function to fit on one screen.

item.title: Coding Guidelines & Best Practices - Perl
item.description: Discussing issues such as ViMconfig, Comments, Naming Conventions, Logging, Code Formatting. Also discussed at Reddit.

item.title: Uncommon OS Platforms Wanted for Testing
item.description: The CPAN Testers would like to see more testing being done on the less common platforms. If you happen to have access to operating systems that are not on the top of the OS/Perl matrix.

item.title: Testing my API changes with Perl
item.description: A test script using LWP::UserAgent to access a web page, and JSON to convert the returned JSON string to a Perl data structure.

item.title: Foswiki 1.2.0 Beta 1 Ready for Testing!
How to add 'provides' metadata via Makefile.PL
item.description: Though I think in most cases this should happen automatically, in the rare cases when you need to fiddle with the names listed in the META files, this explanation can be useful

item.title: CPAN pull requests in March 2015
item.description: The number of pull requests is slightly up since February

item.title: April 1 - Act
item.description: Act is the web application used to manage most of the Perl conference, workshops, and even the Hackathons. Theo reports about the TPF grant he received to modernize the application.

item.title: Early Perl 6
item.description: I am not sure about the title. The article shows how to compile and install MoarVM and Rakudo Star.

item.title: WenZPerl Donate 10,000 EUR to new Perl 6 Core Development Fund
item.description: WenZPerl is the company of Elizabeth Mattijsen and Wendy van Dijk who do an awful lot for Perl. Both code wise and promotion wise. Now they even given their money. (.. and this is not even the first time!)

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Methods, Functions and Subroutines in Perl and what is $self ?
item.description: What is the difference between a method and a function in Perl? What is in $self ? And what is $me ?

item.title: Getting started with Net::Server - building an echo server
Inheritance and Method Modifiers in Moo
How to calculate factorial in Perl - n!
Add some acceptance tests using search.cpan.org
item.description: A screencast from the series about the search.cpan.org cloning project.

item.title: YAPC::Russia 2015
3 Awesome Perl Events in NYC this Spring/Summer
item.description: Quack & Hack NYC, April 4th; NYC Perl Hackathon, May 2nd; Mojoconf, June 4th-6th

item.title: Come to MojoConf and tell us something cool!
item.description: MojoConf will be held in New York City (June 4th-6th).
